AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.marijuana: possession of which Carlos Martinez-Romero was convicted, found in six bundles totaling one hundred and sixty-nine pounds in the toolbox
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Carlos Martinez-Romero's crew-cab truck: vehicle used by Carlos Martinez-Romero during the stop, with a modified back seat, registered in Edna, Texas, suspected to be involved in alien-smuggling based on its origin and registration
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent David: vehicle used by United States Border Patrol Agent David Fitzgerald to follow Carlos Martinez-Romero
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the modification: alteration to the crew-cab truck's back seat area, suspected to be for illegal purposes, observed by United States Border Patrol Agent David Fitzgerald
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.toolbox in Carlos Martinez-Romero's crew: container found in the back of Carlos Martinez-Romero's crew-cab truck, holding six bundles of marijuana
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.valid border-crosser card presented by C: document presented by Carlos Martinez-Romero as proof of legal crossing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.proof of Mexican citizenship presented b: document presented by Carlos Martinez-Romero as proof of citizenship
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.modified back seat of Carlos Martinez-Ro: missing back seat area, suspected to be used for stow-away location
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.modified back seat area of Carlos Martin: area where the back seat was missing, suspected to be used for stow-away location
